title: Chapter 5: Inheritance - Quiz
description: Comprehensive test of inheritance, super(), method overriding, MRO, multiple inheritance, composition, and mixins

questions.question: What is inheritance in OOP?
questions.explanation: Inheritance allows a class to inherit attributes and methods from a parent class.

questions.question: What is the parent class also called?
questions.explanation: Parent class is also called base class or superclass.

questions.question: What is the child class also called?
questions.explanation: Child class is also called derived class or subclass.

questions.question: How to inherit from a parent class?
questions.explanation: Python uses parentheses for inheritance: class Child(Parent):

questions.question: What does super() do?
questions.explanation: super() returns a proxy object that allows calling parent class methods.

questions.question: What is method overriding?
questions.explanation: Method overriding is when a child class provides its own implementation of parent's method.

questions.question: What is MRO?
questions.explanation: MRO stands for Method Resolution Order - determines method lookup order.

questions.question: How to view MRO of a class?
questions.explanation: Use ClassName.mro() method or ClassName.__mro__ attribute.

questions.question: What is multiple inheritance?
questions.explanation: Multiple inheritance is when a class inherits from more than one parent class.

questions.question: What is the diamond problem?
questions.explanation: Diamond problem occurs when a class inherits from two classes that inherit from same base.

questions.question: What algorithm does Python use for MRO?
questions.explanation: Python uses C3 linearization algorithm for computing MRO.

questions.question: What is composition?

options.text: Class contains instances of other classes

questions.explanation: Composition is 'has-a' relationship - class contains instances of other classes.

questions.question: Composition vs Inheritance - which is 'has-a'?
questions.explanation: Composition represents 'has-a' relationship; inheritance represents 'is-a' relationship.

questions.question: What is a mixin?

options.text: Class that provides methods to other classes via multiple inheritance

questions.explanation: Mixin is a class designed to provide specific functionality to other classes.

questions.question: When to favor composition over inheritance?
questions.explanation: Favor composition when there's no clear 'is-a' relationship or need flexibility.

questions.question: Can you call grandparent methods?
questions.explanation: super() follows MRO, allowing access to grandparent methods through chain.

questions.question: What is isinstance() used for?

options.text: Check if object is instance of class

questions.explanation: isinstance(obj, Class) checks if obj is an instance of Class or its subclasses.

questions.question: What is issubclass() used for?

options.text: Check if class is subclass of another

questions.explanation: issubclass(Child, Parent) checks if Child is a subclass of Parent.
If child doesn't define __init__, parent's __init__ is automatically used.

questions.question: What is method chaining with super()?

options.text: Each class calls super() to cooperate

questions.explanation: Method chaining ensures all parent methods are called through cooperative super() calls.

questions.question: Child class automatically inherits all parent methods.
questions.explanation: Child class inherits all public and protected methods from parent.

questions.question: super() is required in child's __init__.
questions.explanation: super() is not required but recommended to properly initialize parent class.

questions.question: Python supports multiple inheritance.
questions.explanation: Python supports multiple inheritance - a class can inherit from multiple parents.

questions.question: Method overriding changes parent's original method.
questions.explanation: Overriding provides new implementation in child; parent's method unchanged.

questions.question: Composition is generally more flexible than inheritance.
questions.explanation: Composition provides more flexibility and looser coupling than inheritance.

questions.question: MRO is left-to-right, depth-first.
questions.explanation: Python uses C3 linearization, not simple depth-first - it's more sophisticated.

questions.question: A class can inherit from itself.
questions.explanation: A class cannot inherit from itself - would create infinite loop.

questions.question: isinstance() checks inheritance hierarchy.
questions.explanation: isinstance() returns True if object is instance of class or any parent class.

questions.question: Mixins should be instantiated directly.
questions.explanation: Mixins are designed to provide functionality, not be instantiated directly.

questions.question: Child class can add new methods not in parent.
questions.explanation: Child classes can add new methods beyond those inherited from parent.

questions.question: Types of inheritance relationships? (Select all)
questions.explanation: Python supports single, multiple, and multilevel. Circular is not valid.

questions.question: Benefits of inheritance? (Select all)
questions.explanation: Inheritance provides reuse, hierarchy, extensibility - not necessarily speed.

questions.question: When to use composition? (Select all)
questions.explanation: Use composition for has-a, flexibility, loose coupling - not always instead.

questions.question: Mixin characteristics? (Select all)
questions.explanation: Mixins provide functionality, used with multiple inheritance, small/focused - not standalone.

questions.question: Valid uses of super()? (Select all)
questions.explanation: super() calls parent __init__, methods, follows MRO - doesn't skip.

questions.question: Complete: Inherit from parent
questions.explanation: Use parentheses to inherit: class Child(Parent):

questions.question: Complete: Call parent constructor
questions.explanation: Use super().__init__() to call parent constructor.

questions.question: Complete: Override method
questions.explanation: Define method with same name to override parent's method.

questions.question: Complete: Multiple inheritance
questions.explanation: List multiple parents separated by commas.

questions.question: Complete: Check instance
questions.explanation: Use isinstance(obj, Class) to check instance type.

questions.question: Simple Inheritance
questions.description: Create Animal parent with speak() method. Create Dog child that overrides speak() to return 'Woof!'.
questions.starterCode:
# Create Animal parent class

# Create Dog child class

questions.question: Use super() in Constructor
questions.description: Create Person with name. Create Student(Person) with name and grade, calling super().__init__().

questions.question: Method Override with super()
questions.description: Parent has greet() returning 'Hello'. Child overrides to call super().greet() + ' from Child'.

questions.question: Multiple Inheritance
questions.description: Create Flyable with fly() and Swimmable with swim(). Create Duck inheriting both.
questions.starterCode:
# Create Flyable with fly method

# Create Swimmable with swim method

# Create Duck inheriting both

questions.question: Composition Pattern
questions.description: Create Engine class. Create Car class that contains an Engine instance (composition).

parts.question: Child inherits parent's methods
parts.explanation: Child class inherits all parent methods and attributes.

parts.question: What does super() return?
parts.explanation: super() returns a proxy object for parent class access.

parts.question: Call parent __init__
parts.explanation: Use super().__init__() to call parent constructor.

parts.question: Overriding modifies parent's method
parts.explanation: Overriding provides new implementation; parent unchanged.

parts.question: How to override?
parts.explanation: Define method with same name in child class.

parts.question: Can call parent method from override
parts.explanation: Use super().method_name() to call parent version.

parts.question: Python supports multiple inheritance
parts.explanation: Python allows inheriting from multiple parents.

parts.question: Composition is more flexible
parts.explanation: Composition provides more flexibility than inheritance.

parts.question: When to use composition? (Select all)
parts.explanation: Use composition for has-a, flexibility, loose coupling.
